column_info.description: Unique identifier (UUID) for the event.
Timestamp when the event message was produced to Kafka.
Timestamp recorded by the event source indicating when the event occurred.
UUID of the product related to the assignment term change.
UUID of the vendor related to the assignment term change.
Nested event metadata including client details and user information; may contain personal data such as user UUID and location.
Internal numeric identifier of the assignment term affected by the change.
Structured event metadata including event UUID, timestamps, client location/device info, experiments, and embedded user info (uuid and roles).
Timestamp of the event occurrence as recorded in the payload.
Unique numeric identifier for the change request.
Identifier or display name of the user who requested the change.
Unique UUID identifying the originating event.
Identifier of the assignment term affected by the change request.
Timestamp when the event was produced to Kafka.
Short code or category representing the reason for the change.
Boolean flag indicating whether the change request was initiated by an internal user or system.
Free-text explanation provided for why the change was requested.
Normalized form of the requester identifier for standardized matching and analysis.
Category or type of the change request (for example, extend or shorten).
Identifier of the product associated with the assignment term.
Timestamp indicating when the status change event occurred.
Nested event metadata containing event identifiers, client information, and user details; may include PII such as user UUID and location.
Unique identifier for the status-change event.
Identifier of the vendor associated with the assignment term.
Timestamp when the event was produced to Kafka.
Numeric identifier of the assignment term whose status changed.
New status value for the assignment term (for example: active, inactive).
Date when metrics were aggregated in YYYY-MM-DD format.
Return on ad spend (ROAS) metric calculated for the ad.
Operational status of the account.
Tracking template applied to the ad's URL for parameter insertion.
Format or type of the ad (e.g., text, responsive).
Click-through rate (clicks divided by impressions).
Final landing page URL optimized for mobile devices.
Average cost incurred per assist action.
Ratio of conversions to clicks for the ad.
Custom tracking parameters associated with the ad.
Operational status of the ad group (e.g., enabled, paused).
Indicator of ad position (top of page versus other positions).
Operational status of the campaign (e.g., active, paused).
Bid match type used for matching bids (e.g., exact, phrase).
Advertising network where the ad was displayed.
Total advertising spend for the ad during the aggregation period.
Identifier for the campaign containing the ad.
Revenue attributed per assist action.
Revenue attributed per conversion.
Unique identifier for the ad.
Number of assist actions contributing to conversions.
Average cost per click for the ad.
Where the ad was shown (for example Search or Content networks).
Match type between the delivered ad and the target (e.g., exact, phrase).
Number of conversions attributed to the ad.
Identifier for the ad group containing the ad.
Identifier for the advertiser account; may identify an individual or business.
Number of times the ad was shown.
Destination URL users land on when clicking the ad.
ISO currency code used for monetary metrics.
Number of clicks the ad received.
Average cost paid for each conversion.
Operating system of the device where the ad was served.
Revenue attributed to the ad's conversions.
Operational status of the ad (e.g., enabled, paused).
Language targeting or detected language for the impression.
Type of device (e.g., mobile, desktop, tablet).
Final landing page URL after any redirects.
URL displayed in the ad creative.
Final app deep link URL used after click-through.
Average revenue attributed to each assist interaction.
ISO 4217 currency code used for monetary metrics in this row.
Total number of times campaign ads were shown.
Channel or placement type where the ad was distributed (e.g., Search, Content).
Operational status of the advertiser account (e.g., active, paused, suspended).
Date representing when metrics were aggregated for this row.
Type of keyword match used for ad delivery (e.g., exact, phrase, broad).
Count of assist interactions that contributed to conversions.
Average cost associated with each assist interaction.
Campaign-level tracking URL template used for click tracking; may contain query parameters.
Operating system of the device where the ad was served.
Return on ad spend (ROAS), indicating revenue generated per unit of spend.
Total number of clicks recorded for the campaign.
Advertising network or channel where the ad appeared (e.g., Search, Display).
Total revenue attributed to the campaign for the reporting period.
Identifier for the advertiser account in Bing Ads.
Unique identifier for the advertising campaign.
Click-through rate: clicks divided by impressions.
Average cost per click for the campaign.
Total advertising spend for the campaign during the reporting period.
Type of device where the ad was displayed (e.g., Desktop, Mobile, Tablet).
Rate of conversions relative to the chosen denominator (commonly clicks).
Number of conversions attributed to the campaign.
Average revenue attributed to each conversion.
Bid match type applied for campaign bidding.
Average cost incurred for each conversion.
Operational status of the campaign (e.g., enabled, paused, deleted).
Placement grouping indicating top-of-page positions versus other placements.
Custom campaign-level parameters used for tracking or reporting.
Identifier for the assignment term related to this contingent change.
Nested metadata containing event context, client_info (location, device), experiments, and user details; may include user identifiers and location fields.
Timestamp when the event was written to Kafka or ingested into the pipeline.
Unique identifier for the event instance.
UUID of the affiliated group or organization associated with the contingent.
Identifier for the contingent entity affected by the change.
Original timestamp when the event occurred.
Device and browser attributes (user agent, screen and viewport dimensions, touch capability, connection type, language).
Content management system metadata including experiment, variant, page and form identifiers.
Unique identifier for the event record.
Timestamp when the event was produced to Kafka or the ingestion system.
Page-level details such as URL, referer, content type, language and product identifiers.
Google Analytics client identifiers (for example _ga and _gid) used for session and client tracking.
Flag indicating whether the event originated from an internal source.
Persistent visitor identifier used to link events to the same user across sessions.
Array of assignment term identifiers associated with the offered service.
Canonical timestamp representing when the event occurred in the system.
Nested metadata including event routing, client_info (location, ja4_fingerprint) and user uuid/roles; may contain personal or sensitive identifiers.
Identifier for the related product request transaction.
Timestamp recorded by the client when the event occurred.
Page metadata including URL, referer, content type, language code and product/reference identifiers.
Timestamp indicating when the event was produced to Kafka.
Boolean flag indicating whether the provider or event is internal to the organization.
Device and client details such as user agent, screen and viewport sizes, touch capability and connection type.
Content management system metadata about experiments, variants and page identifiers.
Timestamp recorded on the client at event creation.
Array of assignment term IDs that were offered to the user.
Persistent or anonymous visitor identifier for the session; may be linkable to a person.
Identifier for the product request associated with the event.
Envelope with enriched event metadata including client info (location, fingerprint) and user sub-structure which may contain user UUIDs.
Unique identifier for this specific event record.
Timestamp when the event occurred.
Array of assignment term IDs that were selected by the user.
Google Analytics identifiers (_ga, _gid) associated with the session; can be used to identify users.
Identifier of the payment instrument used for purchases for this account.
Identifier for the parent customer account, if applicable.
ISO currency code used by the account (e.g., USD).
Identifier for the payment method linked to the account.
Account number assigned by Bing Ads.
Identifier of the customer billed for this account.
Financial status of the account (e.g., billed, delinquent).
Default language setting for the account (e.g., en).
Identifier of the user who last modified the account record.
Timestamp of the last modification to the account (ISO formatted string).
Boolean flag indicating whether the account is archived.
Primary user identifier associated with the account.
Primary account identifier.
Auto-tagging configuration applied to the account.
ETL snapshot timestamp when this record was captured.
Display name of the account used in reporting and UIs.
Lifecycle status of the account (e.g., active, suspended).
Account time zone identifier used for reporting and scheduling.
Numeric code indicating the reason the account is paused.
Template used to construct tracking URLs for clicks.
Bidding scheme or strategy applied to the ad group.
Advertising network where the ad group is served (e.g., Search, Content).
Flag indicating whether ad schedule uses the searcher's time zone.
Array of additional ad group settings, flags, or options.
Language targeting code for the ad group (e.g., en, fr).
Identifier of the account that owns the ad group; may identify the account holder.
Current lifecycle status of the ad group (e.g., Active, Paused).
Start date when the ad group becomes active (ISO or YYYY-MM-DD).
End date when the ad group stops being active (ISO or YYYY-MM-DD).
Privacy or visibility setting for the ad group.
Identifier for the customer associated with the ad group; may identify a person or organization.
Default cost-per-click bid configured for the ad group.
Custom URL parameter key/value pairs used for click tracking.
Suffix appended to final landing page URLs for tracking purposes.
Display name of the ad group.
Unique identifier for the ad group record.
Bid adjustment value applied for audience-targeted bids.
Identifier of the parent campaign that contains this ad group.
Timestamp indicating when this snapshot of the record was created.
Preferred ad format setting for this ad.
Unique identifier for the ad record.
Array of key-value pairs defining custom URL parameter substitutions for tracking.
Editorial review status indicating compliance with platform policies.
Array of final landing page URLs for the ad.
Identifier for the account that owns the ad.
Numeric code indicating device targeting preference (for example, mobile or desktop).
Suffix appended to final URLs for tracking parameters or URL templates.
Template used to generate tracking URLs for clicks on the ad.
Classification or subtype of the ad (e.g., expanded text, responsive).
Array of final app store URLs used for app install creatives.
Operational status of the ad (e.g., enabled, paused, removed).
Identifier of the ad group that contains the ad.
Array of mobile-specific landing page URLs associated with the ad.
Identifier for the campaign that contains the ad.
Timestamp when this ad record was captured or last synchronized.
Identifier for the customer or advertiser associated with the ad.
Display name of the campaign.
Array of campaign-level settings stored as strings (key/value or option names).
Array of campaign type tags or categories (e.g., Search, Shopping).
Current status of the campaign (e.g., Active, Paused, Deleted).
Timestamp when this campaign snapshot was captured.
Type of budget allocation for the campaign (e.g., Daily, Monthly, Shared).
Time zone configured for the campaign (e.g., 'UTC', 'Pacific Standard Time').
Daily budget allocated to the campaign in account currency.
Identifier for the budget object associated with the campaign.
Unique numeric identifier for the campaign.
Bid adjustment integer applied for audience targeting (e.g., percent or flag).
Numeric identifier for the associated advertising account.
Template URL used for tracking clicks and campaign performance.
Bidding strategy or scheme applied to the campaign.
Array of language codes targeted by the campaign.
Numeric identifier for the customer or advertiser account.
